recyclable_offcuts_description: OFFCUTS CAN BE REUSED FOR SAMPLING AND OR CAR MATS OR MATS
compostable_conditions: PLEASE NOTE AS  HAND MADE PRODUCT CONSISTING 100% OF WOOLEN YARN ALOT OF THE QUESTIONS REGARDING DECONSTRUCTED -RECYCLE-TAKEBACK AND REUSE ARE N/S THE RUGS CAN BE CLEANED AND REUSED IN A SECOND HAND MARKET - FREELAY RUGS.ASA NATURAL FIBRE PER THE NZ WOOL AUTHORITY WOOL IS A BIODEGRADABLE FIBRE THAT CAN BREAK DOWN AT END OF LIFE.
water_reduction_techniques: DEPENDENT ON WHICH ORIGIN OF MANUFACTURE EITHER RECYCLED WATER OR HARVESTED RAIN WATER IS USED. PRODUCT IS MANUFACTURED BY HAND- NOT MACHINE MADE
minimisation_design_strategy: YARN FOR THE PROJECT IS NOT TAKEN FROM A PREDYED STOCK PILE OF YARN .THE ONLY YARN DYED OR USED IN THE MANUFACTURE IS THE EXACT AMOUNT FOR THE SPECIFIC SIZE OF THE RUG/S-THE PRODUCT IS MADE TO ORDER TO THE ACTUAL SIZE REQUIREMENT OF THE SPECIFIED AREA OF USE AS SUCH THERE IS NO WASTAGE.
other_comments:
Designer Rugs is dedicated to the improvement of sustainability. We are constantly striving to improve our environmental performance and reduce our impact on the environment.
 
We produce high-quality product, designed to stand the tests of time. Not only are we proud to supply premium product to our clients, but it also reflects our stance on the environmental impact of planned obsolesce – the long lifecycle of our product means reduced waste.  In our rug production, processes are hand controlled to reduce wastage and our carbon footprint.
 
Designer Rugs recognises the importance of renewable materials. Wool forms the major component of our product, which is a naturally renewable and sustainable product. Sheep are part of the natural carbon cycle, consuming the organic carbon stored in plants and converting it to wool. This hard-wearing fibre is also biodegradable at the end of its lifespan.All Wool Fibre [100% Wool] is Carbon Neutral.https://woolsnz.com/sustainability
 
We aim use distribution methods for our product that are environmentally friendly, re-using packaging as much as we can and providing reusable rug bags where possible. We encourage the return and reuse of samples and tufts provided for the product selection process to reduce the impact of sample and tuft production.
 
Internally, our respect for the environment extends to our office policies, where we aim to communicate digitally wherever possible to prevent unnecessary printing. We practice a policy of working without electric lights if they are not required and of ensuring all power is only used when absolutely necessary and we recycle everything we can.
 
We enable specifiers to meet their environmental commitments without compromise aesthetics and quality. Our 100% NZ Wool Products have been tested to the Carpet and Rug Institute Green label Specification (Green Star IEQ-13) for volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and the results indicate the products are low-VOC emitting. Specifying and using these products contributes one credit point under the Green Star Design IEQ-13 credit. 
 
Our environmental and social responsibilities are of paramount importance, and we are committed to the long term aims of sustainable development in all our business activities.
 
Regarding Greenstar [GECA] compliant member document, we do not prescribe to GECA or third party  GREENSTAR membership programs certification that requires the provision of company financial details and profit $ details/turnover to ascertain a point or certification consideration of product.


In accordance with Sustainable practise as custom made rugs specific for the project only the yarn required for the rugs are dyed and manufactured and then handtufted by hand, hence creating a n extensive less footprint than machine made product and/ or yarn bank stored with wastage and negating disposal into land waste of unused yarn. 

Our Sustainability policy can be found on our website on the following links,

https://www.designerrugs.com.au/commercial/materials-and-construction/

https://www.designerrugs.com.au/responsible-manufacturing/

https://www.designerrugs.com.au/designer-rugs-a-30-year-design-legacy-like-no-other/

Regarding our association with Supply Nation, our collaborative indigenous-first nation partner KARI.ORGare a registered Supply Nation Member additional information regarding our existing collaborations and partnerships for over 18 years with Artist Minnie Pwerle and now her family trust and with other first nations artists can be found on the following link, https://www.designerrugs.com.au/indigenous-collections/

product_description: Redefining Flexibility and Collaboration. Seamlessly Transform Your Workspace for Every Task.
recyclable_percentage_description: All Wilkhahn product components are suitable for non-destructive disassembly. In order to guarantee materials are sorted according to type, all components over 150 g in weight are labeled. No agents to protect materials, or organic halogen compounds are used that prevent recycling at a later date.
recyclable_offcuts_description: We strive to develop durable products, increase their utility value and reduce waste. “Less is more” or “reduce to the max” are principles that Wilkhahn constantly reinterprets for the future. Ecological design guidelines are integral components of Wilkhahn product development.
recycling_process_description: Where possible, we use pure materials that are marked as such, making them ideal for recycling.
reusable_description: All Wilkhahn product components are suitable for non-destructive disassembly. In order to guarantee materials are sorted according to type, all components over 150 g in weight are labeled. No agents to protect materials, or organic halogen compounds are used that prevent recycling at a later date.
end_of_life_program_description:
Even after the product has reached the end of its life, we still feel responsible and offer our customers extensive takeback and recycling services. We guarantee to take back all products that are no longer in use. Wilkhahn products are dismantled in the factory, all parts are
 selectively sorted in terms of their inherent materials and then recycled. By labelling the materials, ensuring they’re non-toxic and easy to dismantle, we’re already making sure today that the components in Wilkhahn products can be incorporated into local material and 
 production cycles and be properly recycled and disposed of. As a result, energy guzzling (and therefore ecologically unwise transportation) over long distances is avoided.
minimisation_design_strategy: Because the products are modular, expendable parts can be exchanged and features added or retrofitted (e. g. armrest types, covers, cushions, surfaces). Connecting points in the product can be dismantled for easy repair.
type_of_packaging: Cardboard, foam, packing tape. For local deliveries, blankets and quilts are used.

product_description: Dynamic Seating Redefined with Trimension® Technology. Movement, posture and comfort.
recyclable_percentage_description: The chairs are dismounted at our plant, all components are sorted according to one-type materials and – if possible – are recycled. Due to the clear marking and identification of all materials, due to their nontoxicity and due to easy dismountability, we can today ensure that the components of a Wilkhahn product are returned to both decentral and local material and production cycles and are properly recycled and, if necessary, disposed of. This serves to reduce energy-intensive (and thus ecologically questionable) return transport over long distances.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Because the products are modular, expendable parts can be exchanged and features added or retrofitted (e. g. armrest types, covers, cushions, surfaces). Connecting points in the product can be dismantled for easy repair.
recycling_process_description: When developing the chair, emphasis was placed from very beginning in ensuring maximum recyclability of the materials - as far as technically possible. After the end of its life, 96% of ON can be recycled.
reusable_description: All components of the ON office chair permit non-destructive disassembly. All components weighing more than 150 g bear a material identification mark to ensure that materials can be sorted according to a single type. No material protecting agents or halogen-organic compounds are used that prevent subsequent recycling. A total of 98 percent of components of the chair can be recycled.
end_of_life_program_description: Our responsibility does not stop at the end of the utilization phase of a product as we offer our customers extensive services for taking back and recycling used products. We guarantee that used products may be returned in their entirety.
minimisation_design_strategy: We strive to develop lasting products, increase their utility value and reduce waste. “Less is more” or “reduce to the max” are the guiding principles that Wilkhahn continually translates into future contexts. Ecologically oriented design principles are a natural, integral part of product development.
type_of_packaging: Returnable transport packaging made from renewable raw materials is used for ON office chairs that can be reused, recycled or composted.

Product design to last is our antidote to the throw-away society. Therefore, Wilkhahn products focus on providing maximum utility value, durability and protecting resources. This means top quality that can be experienced, is consistent and perfect. It delivers timeless, distinctive design that is fascinating due to its simplicity, honesty and appeal to all the senses. Pioneering innovations are included that really give our customers constant added value in terms of ergonomics and handling. The fact that our products are extremely practical, 
easy to disassemble and components are replaceable ensures they are resource-efficient.

product_description: Cultivated provides restoration/reuse services for authentic furniture and lighting.
recyclable_percentage_description: We aim to retain as much of the product as possible. Where waste is created, we use local partners including Corex Plastic, Sims Metal and Traks Textile Recycling to process materials. Currently ther eis no avenue to recycle used polyurethane foam in Australia or furniture timbers (those lacquered, laminated or treated).
recyclable_offcuts_description: We use TRAKS textile recycling for fabric offcuts, Corex plastics for polypropylene waste and Sims metal for metal waste. These materials can be recycled.
recycled_content_description: Generally, a large portion of existing materials are retained during restoration.
recycling_process_description: As above, polypropylene plastic, alloys and woven textiles can be recycled. Foam and timber cannot.
reusable_description: Yes, we work with products that can be reuse. The oldest product we have worked on so far are Fritz Hansen Lily chairs form 1973.
end_of_life_program_description: Cultivated is furniture product stewardship program. We only take back second hand products with the aim of providing reuse and longevity on projects through repair and maintenance.
minimisation_design_strategy: We consider how much of the original products is functional and can be retained for reuse.
applied_finish_required_description:
Upholstery
Polyurethane Foam
Paint
Water Based Lacquer
other_comments: Cultivate partners with local workshops in Australia to carry out restoration work. It's important to support local skills and economies and minimise transport across state lines. We currently work with partners in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. As part of this initiative, we have contracted Sydney based Circular Design Thinking to initiate a comprehensive supplier code of conduct which will set minimum standards and guidelines for our supply chain to follow. We recently introduced Digital Product Passports into our range also to provide transparency into our supply chain and to be able to provide waste and transport emissions data to our clients. More on that here. https://cultivated.com.au/blogs/stories/the-digital-product-passport-get-the-full-story-on-every-cultivated-product
type_of_packaging: Currently we are using a plastic bag for protection (recycle number 4), however we have just ordered final prototypes of a reusable calico bag we have designed which will replace all of the plastic bags by third quarter 2024. I can send you more info on these if required.

other_comments:
Leva is the first timber chair designed by Foster + Partners. Manufactured by Mattiazzi, it combines craftsmanship with sophisticated machinery to create a comfortable and ergonomically designed chair. The sparing use of material is rooted in the idea of sustainability – to do more with less. Made of ash
sustainably sourced from Eastern Europe, the chair is designed to reduce the amount of waste generated during its manufacture. Any timber discarded during the machining process is used to fuel the heating system at the factory, supplementing the photovoltaic panels on the factory roof.

other_comments:
Sustainability is at the core of what they do, and all Artisan pieces proudly bear FSC COC certification, ensuring responsible sourcing and manufacturing practices. Emphasising the intrinsic beauty of timber in its purest form, Artisan applies natural finishes, allowing the furniture to breathe and showcasing the natural colour diversity of wood.

As an FSC Chain of Custody certified brand, they adhere to the stringent criteria set by the global leader in sustainable forestry, FSC. This certification guarantees that the forest-based materials used in their production, including reclaimed materials, are FSC certified, and their journey is tracked throughout the manufacturing and distribution processes. Artisan also meets FSC’s core labor requirements, ensuring a fair and ethical production environment.

end_of_life_program_description:
We aim to enhance the life cycle of Reddie furniture and reduce waste through sustainable measures via reuse, refurbishment or recycling. Where possible, we will take back furniture sold by Reddie to reuse or find alternatives to sending products to landfill. Options include: 

(i) Refurbishment of furniture for possible reuse by the existing customer. 
(ii) On-selling or donation of furniture in it's existing condition to other commercial businesses or organisations. 
(iii) Disassembly of furniture for components/materials reuse or recycling.

Our Product Stewardship initiatives will continue to evolve as we look to provide cost effective solutions that are environmentally beneficial and economically viable.

product_description: Wilkhahn Versa: Seamless Design, Limitless Flexibility. Transform Spaces with Effortless Elegance.
recyclable_percentage_description: Please refer to EPI document with recycling capacity identified in material breakdown.
recycling_process_description: Where possible, we use pure materials that are marked as such, making them ideal for recycling.
reusable_description: All Wilkhahn product components are suitable for non-destructive disassembly. In order to guarantee materials are sorted according to type, all components over 150 g in weight are labeled. No agents to protect materials, or organic halogen compounds are used that prevent recycling at a later date.
end_of_life_program_description: Even after the product has reached the end of its life, we still feel responsible and offer our customers extensive takeback and recycling services. We guarantee to take back all products that are no longer in use. Wilkhahn products are dismantled in the factory, all parts are selectively sorted in terms of their inherent materials and then recycled. By labelling the materials, ensuring they’re non-toxic and easy to dismantle, we’re already making sure today that the components in Wilkhahn products can be incorporated into local material and production cycles and be properly recycled and disposed of. As a result, energy guzzling (and therefore ecologically unwise transportation) over long distances is avoided.
minimisation_design_strategy: Product design to last is our antidote to the throw-away society. Therefore, Wilkhahn products focus on providing maximum utility value, durability and protecting resources. This means top quality that can be experienced, is consistent and perfect. It delivers timeless, distinctive design that is fascinating due to its simplicity, honesty and appeal to all the senses. Pioneering innovations are included that really give our customers constant added value in terms of ergonomics and handling. The fact that our products are extremely practical, easy to disassemble and components are replaceable ensures they are resource-efficient.
type_of_packaging: For years we’ve only been using as much packaging to transport our products as is required to deliver them in one piece to our customers. Some 60 to 78% of Wilkhahn’s cardboard packaging consists of recycled material. And Wilkhahn regularly uses blankets and other returnable packaging.

The materials we use are 100% recyclable and retain their quality and properties after each recycling cycle. To simplify the process and promote sustainability, we avoid using staples in our packaging.

modern_slavery_comments: We work only with 100% european producers, which ensures that workers work under decent working conditions, covered by collective agreements, they are protected by job security measures, conditions that are far from precarious and avoid child labour or any form of slavery. . We have developed a code of conduct for suppliers, in which they commit to respect human rights, among other issues.
specific_installation_methods: Avoid glue of fabrics and foam to recycle

other_comments: We work mostly, 80% of purchases are made within 200km, thus supporting the local economy and maintaining close and trusting relationships with our suppliers.
type_of_packaging: For packaging we use items that are mainly made from recycled materials. As for the bags used to protect our products, we can confirm that 50% of them are made from recycled materials. To simplify the process and promote sustainability, we avoid using staples in our packaging.

product_description: Solid 100% Reclaimed Teak Wood Dining Chair
recyclable_offcuts_description: We recycle all of our offcuts into handicrafts and accessories or combined to make other furniture pieces.
recycling_process_description: The wood is solid so can be refinished and resealed.
reusable_description: The wood is solid so can be refinished and resealed.
end_of_life_program_description:
We aim to enhance the life cycle of Reddie furniture and reduce waste through sustainable measures via reuse, refurbishment or recycling. Where possible, we will take back furniture sold by Reddie to reuse or find alternatives to sending products to landfill. Options include: 

(i) Refurbishment of furniture for possible reuse by the existing customer. 
(ii) On-selling or donation of furniture in it's existing condition to other commercial businesses or organisations. 
(iii) Disassembly of furniture for components/materials reuse or recycling.

Our Product Stewardship initiatives will continue to evolve as we look to provide cost effective solutions that are environmentally beneficial and economically viable.
minimisation_design_strategy: Product is made from 100% reclaimed materials, offcuts are used for our furniture accessories.

product_description: Iconic Arne Jacobsen chair in moulded veneer, available in various finishes and upholstery options.

certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, steel can be recycled onshore, shells can be refurbished and upholstered through Cultivated
recycling_process_description: Yes, components can be reused and refurbished through Cultivated, steel can be recycled
reusable_description: In case of repair and disposal the chairs can be disassembled into two parts (shell and base). The base and all other metal parts can be recycled.
end_of_life_program_description:
Yes, Cult partner business, Cultivated. Cultivated is committed to a fully circular model that keeps high-quality furniture in use and out of landfill. Through their buy-back for credit program, they acquire pre-owned designer pieces, carefully refurbish them, and reintroduce them into both residential and commercial spaces.
By working with local craftspeople and manufacturers, they ensure every item is restored with care and built to last, also boosting local trade and economies with these trusted partnerships.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Depends on the location, but we have agreement with most forwarders about truck packing and route efficiencies
minimisation_design_strategy: Separate packaging to recycle accordingly. Supplied as whole furniture piece without wastage upon install.

detailed_certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

risk_of_harm_posed_description: Solvent based lacquer and glue may affect nature in production, but all VOC is captured and burned (through a thermal oxidation process) to do no harm.
factory_finished_description: Wet applied primer and coloured lacquer finish on veneer
other_comments:
Spare parts are available for all chairs, all components can be ordered. Chrome bases use Chrome 3, powdercoat bases also available. Lacquered or veneer chairs can be upholstered for a new life, and to be kept circular.
 

Other testing includes 
Strength and durability: EN 16139 (EN 1728)
Test Level 1 General Contract use*
Stability: EN 1022:2005

Fritz Hansen works with a number of certified timber suppliers in Europe, with FSC and/or PEFC Certification. Exact city locations vary depending on availability when sourcing raw materials and components. Exact information can be supplied at time of enquiry. For example, component breakdown includes:

Inner veneer Beech, 50,6%, Germany/France (may vary)
Outer veneer Ash, 3,9%  Czech Repiblic/Belgium/France (may vary)
Steel base, 41,5%, Poland
Plastic, 3,7%, Denmark/Poland
type_of_packaging:
PE foam and cardboard are used as protection between
stacked chairs. The chairs are covered with a plastic bag and shipped in FSC cardboard. PE foam and soft plastics can be recycled through designated recycling programs in Australia. Visit recyclingnearyou.com.au/polystyrene/ from Planet Ark.

All these materials come from responsibly and sustainably managed forests, which is guaranteed by the FSC certificate. To simplify the process and promote sustainability, we avoid using staples in our packaging.

process for outdoor maximum resistance.
other_comments: We work mostly, 80% of purchases are made within 200km, thus supporting the local economy and maintaining close and trusting relationships with our suppliers.
type_of_packaging: For packaging we use items that are mainly made from recycled materials. On average, our boxes have 70% recycled content, and several of our references already boast 100% recycled  content. All these materials come from responsibly and sustainably managed forests, which is guaranteed by the FSC certificate. As for the bags used to protect our products, we can confirm that 50% of them are made from recycled materials. The materials we use are 100% recyclable and retain their quality and properties after each recycling cycle. To simplify the process and promote sustainability, we avoid using staples in our packaging.

recyclable_percentage_description: Humanscale products are designed for disassembly and recycling at the end of life. Humanscale products are also designed to last long and can be reused.
recyclable_offcuts_description: This does not apply to Humanscale products, and our packaging is recyclable.
recycling_process_description: For more information, see Design for Environment (DfE) https://www.humanscale.com/userfiles/file/desing-for-environment.pdf
reusable_description: Humanscale products are designed for disassembly and recycling at EOL. Humanscale products are also designed to last long and can be reused.
end_of_life_program_description: Humanscale offers our circularity program called "BEAM," in which we connect our customers to an end-of-life vendor who can sustainably decommission the product at the end of life.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes, 100% of the water used in Humanscale's Piscataway facility is on-site harvested rainwater. Float Mini, sold in the APAC market, is manufactured in PIscatway, NJ.
minimisation_design_strategy: This does not apply to Humanscale products, and our packaging is recyclable.
modern_slavery_comments: Each year, we evaluate our first tier suppliers for risk of child labor, forced labor or restriction to freedom of association and human rights, based on their location and type of operation. Our on-site audit plan is developed to prioritize suppliers with greater risk of non-compliance.
factory_finished_description: Worksurface Material: Eco-friendly Bamboo, Powder-Coated MDF, Natural Linoleum. Base: Powder-coated. Caster wheels are also available for added portability
other_comments: Float Mini does not utilise any harmful Red List chemicals, such as formaldehyde. In addition, we chose to use bamboo for the work surface as opposed to traditional wood. Bamboo takes less than 10 years to replenish, making it the more planet-friendly option. By comparison, the wood used in standard tops comes from old-growth forests, which can take up to 100 years to regrow.

product_description: Curated range of sustainable recomposed timber veneers

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems

recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes — we encourage designers to reuse or upcycle offcuts and can provide guidance on effective ways to minimise waste.
reusable_description: The product can be reused where appropriate; its demountability depends on the installation method and application conditions.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes, 70% recycled water used at Veneer manufacturing site
minimisation_design_strategy: Align panel and joinery dimensions with standard sheet sizes to maximise material yield. For instance, designing 600 mm wide modules from a 1200 mm wide sheet minimises offcuts and waste compared to non-modular dimensions.
specific_installation_methods: Yes — where mechanical fixings are used, panels can be designed for demountability and reuse. Adhesive methods may limit recyclability or reinstallation potential.
applied_finish_required_description: Once fabricated, the timber veneer will need to be sealed. There are various options depending on the level of protection required, ranging from oils and waxes through to 2 pack polyurethane.
type_of_packaging: Reusable timber crates and pallets are used with recyclable plastic strapping. Veneer and edging are packaged in recycled cardboard. Veneer crates are wrapped in plastic to protect the veneer from water & sun light - this can be reused.

modern_slavery_comments: We work only with 100% european producers, which ensures that workers work under decent working conditions, covered by collective agreements, they are protected by job security measures, conditions that are far from precarious and avoid child labour or any form of slavery. . We have developed a code of conduct for suppliers, in which they commit to respect human rights, among other issues.
specific_installation_methods: Avoid glue of fabrics and foam to recycle
applied_finish_required_description: Customizable color structure. Shell piece available in five different colors, can be fully upholstered or seat pad.
other_comments: We work mostly, 80% of purchases are made within 200km, thus supporting the local economy and maintaining close and trusting relationships with our suppliers.
type_of_packaging: For packaging we use items that are mainly made from recycled materials. On average, our boxes have 70% recycled content, and several of our references already boast 100% recycled  content. All these materials come from responsibly and sustainably managed forests, which is guaranteed by the FSC certificate. As for the bags used to protect our products, we can confirm that 50% of them are made from recycled materials. The materials we use are 100% recyclable and retain their quality and properties after each recycling cycle. To simplify the process and promote sustainability, we avoid using staples in our packaging.

minimisation_design_strategy: Reduction of material used in components without compromising strengths, efficiency in production processes, optimization of product design and packaging, new more efficient machinery,
modern_slavery_comments: We work only with 100% european producers, which ensures that workers work under decent working conditions, covered by collective agreements, they are protected by job security measures, conditions that are far from precarious and avoid child labour or any form of slavery. . We have developed a code of conduct for suppliers, in which they commit to respect human rights, among other issues.
specific_installation_methods: Avoid glue of fabrics and foam to recycle
applied_finish_required_description: Customizable structure in color and in four different options: 4 legs, sled, wood and swivel. Shell in polypropylene, with seat pad or fully upholstered. Availability of different types of fabrics.
other_comments: We work mostly, 80% of purchases are made within 200km, thus supporting the local economy and maintaining close and trusting relationships with our suppliers.
type_of_packaging: For packaging we use items that are mainly made from recycled materials. On average, our boxes have 70% recycled content, and several of our references already boast 100% recycled  content. All these materials come from responsibly and sustainably managed forests, which is guaranteed by the FSC certificate. As for the bags used to protect our products, we can confirm that 50% of them are made from recycled materials. The materials we use are 100% recyclable and retain their quality and properties after each recycling cycle. To simplify the process and promote sustainability, we avoid using staples in our packaging.

recyclable_percentage_description: Onshore recycling facility installed at local Manufacturing plants.
recyclable_offcuts_description: The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard at Oberon facility. Offcuts of MDF is used for packing material and gluts.
recycling_process_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
reusable_description: The entire product with edging or laminate can be recycled or repurposed.
end_of_life_program_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Australian Owned/Australian Made local manufacturing
minimisation_design_strategy: Designing to the sheet sizes and try to optimise the sheet to its maximum.
